  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    List of utility methods to operate with effectiveness indicators

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void cleanUpModulesVisibility(AmpAidEffectivenessIndicator indicator)
      When indicator is physically deleted we need to clean up the reference in the amp_modules_visibility table To clean up trash in the Global FM tree
      static void createModulesVisibility(java.lang.String indicatorName)
      If indicator gets activated we need to "return it back" (create) to the Global FM tree
      static AmpAidEffectivenessIndicator deleteIndicator(long indicatorId)
      Do not delete via Id, but load first Because we want to delete related options as well

      Loads indicator option by primary key from the database
      static java.util.Set<AmpAidEffectivenessIndicatorOption> populateSelectedOptions(AmpActivityVersion activity)
      Add the configured indicators (actually, the default option of each indicator) to the activity (if it has not been added before)

      Returns list of indicators by the criteria
      static void sortSelectedEffectivenessOptions(AmpActivityVersion activity)
      Sorts the HashSet of options assigned to the activity, replacing it with the sorted LinkedHashSet The options are sorted by the ids of the related indicators
      static void updateModulesVisibility(AmpAidEffectivenessIndicator indicator, java.lang.String oldIndicatorName)
      When indicator name is changed, the name in Global FM tree should be changed respectively

        public static AmpAidEffectivenessIndicator deleteIndicator(long indicatorId)

      • deleteOption

        Delete option and the relationship with indicator
        Parameters:
        optionId - the option id to be deleted
        Returns:

      • populateSelectedOptions

        public static java.util.Set<AmpAidEffectivenessIndicatorOption> populateSelectedOptions(AmpActivityVersion activity)

        Returns:
